image.altText: A bird's eye view of the Bourke Street Mall in Melbourne with several people out the front.

props.synopsis: Police say they've arrested four teenage boys in Melbourne's CBD after chasing them from Doncaster in the city's east.

title.children: Four teenage boys arrested after Bourke Street Mall incident

image.altText: A  man wearing a cap and a grey hoodie marked R4W looks into camera with a serious facial expression.

props.synopsis: The grand final-bound Origin prop and at least three other players are promoting a clothing brand linked to the Alameddine crime family, fuelling police concern the league has failed to stem the influence of organised crime.

title.children: Bronco fronts crime-linked activewear brand

image.altText: Tylere Baker-Pearce outside court

props.synopsis: Tylere Baker-Pearce, 39, was arrested by counterterrorism police outside a Brisbane court on Monday.

title.children: Man charged with giving Nazi salute at the AFL facing two new counts

image.altText: A man gestures as he looks at camera.

props.synopsis: Luke Anthony Shaw, Paul William Shaw and Patrick Kenneth Dolbey were charged with the murder of David Wayne Jenkins, who was stabbed 11 times in October 2022.

title.children: Man found guilty of murder, two others of manslaughter in David Jenkins trial

image.altText: Signage at an Optus store in Melbourne

props.synopsis: Embattled telco Optus has apologised for a network outage that led to nine failed triple-0 calls near Wollongong on the NSW south coast over the weekend.

title.children: Optus investigates more failed triple-0 calls in NSW outage

image.altText: pills

props.synopsis: The TGA has urged patients to stop using unregulated melatonin products after testing revealed “significant discrepancies” between their actual melatonin amount and what was on the label.

title.children: Melatonin product has 400 per cent more than advertised, regulator warns

image.altText: Annette Brennan Lagi

props.synopsis: 47-year-old Stephen Fleming, who has pleaded guilty to manslaughter, is accused of ending his new housemate's life last year and stuffing the English teacher's body in a green waste bin.

title.children: Killer was 'extremely callous' in dumping victim's body

image.altText: A group of rescuers wearing bright orange coats and with bushwalking packs on their backs stand in a group.

props.synopsis: Cradle Mountain is one of Tasmania's most popular, and dangerous, tourism destinations. After another tragedy, questions are asked about what more could be done to ensure the safety of visitors.

title.children: After another Cradle Mountain death, how can tourists be better prepared?

image.altText: A close-up of the directions on a small bottle of pepper spray.

props.synopsis: Security guards at a Darwin nightclub have been confronted with pepper spray two weekends in a row, during the first month of a Northern Territory-wide trial of the weapons.

title.children: Union labels pepper spray trial 'dangerous' after two incidents in two weeks

image.altText: An official removes the winners' trophy from the presentation area

props.synopsis: India T20 skipper Suryakumar Yadav has claimed that his team was denied the chance to lift the 2025 Asia Cup trophy, after it beat Pakistan in the final by five wickets on Sunday.

title.children: India claim they were denied Asia Cup trophy after win over Pakistan

image.altText: a pink pub with a sign saying 'larrimah hotel'

props.synopsis: The Larrimah Hotel sells to an Alice Springs businesswoman, after capturing the world's attention in podcasts and films about the disappearance 77-year-old Paddy Moriarty.

title.children: Owner sells outback pub shrouded in mystery after 70yo's disappearance

image.altText: Drone Main

props.synopsis: Police allege the the man was trying to deliver drugs, nicotine patches, USB sticks and a smart watch to prisoners inside a Canberra jail.

title.children: Young father caught allegedly flying drone into Canberra prison to drop drugs

image.altText: An SES volunteer in orange overalls walks across grassland towards a row of SES and police vehicles

props.synopsis: SA Police say "time is of the essence" in its search for a four-year-old boy who has been missing from his family's homestead in South Australia's mid-north since Saturday evening.

title.children: Police horses and water operations join 'extensive' search for missing 4yo

image.altText: a woman stands in front of two old gum trees which are fenced off, she is looking to her left and the sun is shining on her face

props.synopsis: Kylie Soanes says urban development should not come at the expense of nature and there's no reason why we should not spot a fairy wren on the way to the bus stop.

title.children: One woman's mission to rewild our cities

image.altText: An aerial photo of a large Chinese ferry docking next to a landing barge. The barge has a pier extended from its front section.

props.synopsis: A classified US intelligence report, seen by the ABC, says vessels have been modified to carry tanks and partake in amphibious operations in what Taiwan considers part of China's "expansionist intentions".

title.children: China ferry fleet built amid Taiwan invasion preparations, classified report warns

image.altText: twisted corrugated metal sheets and poles fall and lie on top of a dented red hatchback and cover grey car

props.synopsis: At least nine people have died after heavy rain and strong winds from the former Typhoon Bualoi flooded roads, knocked off roofs in central Vietnam, state media reported, with residents describing it as "one of the strongest".

title.children: At least nine dead after Typhoon Bualoi makes landfall in Vietnam

image.altText: Bright flowers at the Victoria Police Memorial in the Kings Domain Gardens, Melbourne.

props.synopsis: Three police officers shot dead in the line of duty this year are being honoured as part of National Police Remembrance Day services around Australia.

title.children: National services remember fallen officers as Porepunkah manhunt wound back

image.altText: A young girl jumping on a mattress on a red dirt ground.

props.synopsis: Many Aboriginal people in Tennant Creek live in overcrowded makeshift shelters with no running water or electricity, as they wait up to a decade for a home. But experts say the social housing being built is not safe for the climate of today, let alone into the future.

title.children: These Australians are homeless with a house

image.altText: An aerial photograph of a church fully engulfed in flame.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of people were inside The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Grand Blanc Township when a 40-year-old man rammed his pick-up truck through the front door, then got out of the vehicle and started shooting.

title.children: Four dead after gunman opens fire in a Michigan Mormon church service

image.altText: Kwar Ater, wearing a white shirt and smiling hugely.

props.synopsis: The 26-year-old was shot dead in Melbourne's CBD earlier this month, leaving his shocked family in search of answers.

title.children: 'Wanted to be part of something': 26yo killed as life was turning a corner

image.altText: Broken glass on a street in front of a brick building that has been graffitied.

props.synopsis: A rainforest minutes from the CBD, a food production bowl and riverside walkways are among the big ideas being discussed for Lismore as it continues to recover from the 2022 floods.

title.children: Big plans to change the face of disaster-hit city could take decades

image.altText: a large wavy sculpture outside the brisbane court precinct in the sunshine

props.synopsis: In 2017 two boys and their father, who cannot be identified for legal reasons, were badly burnt when their rural property went up in flames.

title.children: Coroner to examine whether parents involved in deadly house fire

image.altText: Back of woman in black top and jeans with long dark hair arms outstretched on stage in front of packed room hands in the air

props.synopsis: Astrid Jorgensen has an unusual condition — she finds many human noises unbearable. So how did she end up running the "world's biggest choir"?

title.children: Astrid tried to be a nun. Instead, she created one of our biggest music acts

image.altText: Bald man in long sleeve blue collared shirt leaving Horsham court house.

props.synopsis: Suspended mining company employee Murray Wilson will fight a falsifying documents charge relating to a proposed mineral sands project in north-west Victoria.

title.children: WIM Resource mining employee charged with falsifying document

image.altText: A smiling, dark-haired young woman on a beach at dusk.

props.synopsis: James Scott Church stood trial in 2022 for the 23-year-old's murder, but died before the verdict was handed down.

title.children: Cold case closed as coroner finds partner killed Leisl Smith

image.altText: Erica and Rory McIlroy stand together looking out at the golf course.

props.synopsis: Rory McIlroy supports his wife Erica, who was said to be on the receiving end of "astonishing" abuse from American fans during the Ryder Cup in New York.

title.children: McIlroy defends wife after 'astonishing' abuse from US Ryder Cup fans

image.altText: Stefano Utoikamanu running with the football, looking to his left, preparing to pass the ball

props.synopsis: Melbourne prop Stefano Utoikamanu lights the fuse for an explosive NRL grand final on Sunday, setting his sights on steamrolling "stuck-up" Brisbane opponents.

title.children: Storm enforcer puts target on 'stuck up' Broncos ahead of NRL grand final

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holding both hands above his head, waving to a crowd from a lectern.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and British counterpart Sir Keir Starmer embrace on stage in Liverpool, northern England, where rumours have been swirling about a leadership challenge to the UK PM.

title.children: PM hails UK–Australia relationship and vows to 'defend democracy itself'

image.altText: Illustration of woman wearing Star of David necklace, wearing a green top and hand on chest

props.synopsis: Some members of Australia's Jewish community say they have experienced ongoing trauma and fear months after a video came to light that included threats to Israeli patients.

title.children: 'High level of distrust of medical staff': Trauma remains after nurses' video

image.altText: A man with tattoos on his chest and neck wears a baseball cap

props.synopsis: Three people face a Perth court accused of murdering 33-year-old Jayden Selfe, whose disappearance sparked an extensive investigation and led to the discovery of his body north of the city.

title.children: Police charge three people with murder after man's body found in bushland

image.altText: A photo collage of Trump's silhouette framing a backdrop of offshore wind turbines

props.synopsis: US researchers have tracked how dark money funds a tangled web of climate denial think tanks with vested interests in slowing climate action. And Australia is not immune.

title.children: Trump-style 'climate hoax' playbook spreads to Australia

image.altText: A man with blonde hair in a suit shakes hand with a man with black hair in a suit

props.synopsis: China is driving hard to supplant the US in this new military industrial complex, and has already achieved leadership in electric vehicles, batteries, drones and renewable energy.

title.children: Fusion-power deal heralds beginning of next great energy transition

image.altText: Paul Brereton speaks during inquiry.

props.synopsis: The head of the national anti-corruption commission told a Senate inquiry he had resigned his role at the defence force's investigative arm. But the ABC has learned he continued consulting for them, and documents proving his resignation could not be identified.

title.children: Anti-corruption chief kept consulting role after saying he had resigned

image.altText: An Australian flag flies against a blue sky, in front of seven tents pitched on Antarctic ice.

props.synopsis: A funding bid to establish a polar security research program has been knocked back, despite the changing geopolitical dynamics in Antarctica and the Southern Ocean.

title.children: Antarctic and Southern Ocean security in spotlight after failed funding bid

image.altText: A reporter smiles next to a very large horned white cattle, with her hand on its back.

props.synopsis: Ann Cochram's eyes light up when she talks about the "magical" cattle she breeds, which can weigh as much as a small car.

title.children: 'Majestic' cattle too large for some butchers to process, farmer says
